channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Transmission Gully: Govt orders review, NZTA says there are 'lessons to learn'
item.description: The NZTA says it has learnt lessons with $1.25 billion of taxpayers money used to build Wellington highway Transmission Gully as the government orders the project be reviewed.

item.title: $5m Lotto ticket left in glovebox for a week while winners were oblivious
item.description: An Invercargill couple who won a $5 million share of last weekend's massive Powerball prize kept the ticket in their car's glovebox, oblivious to how much it was worth.

item.title: As it happened: Covid-19 updates on Friday 21 August
item.description: Jacinda Ardern says NZ's alert levels will not be lifted early, adding that those who blame and shame people with the coronavirus are 'dangerous'.

item.title: Covid-19: Nine new community cases in NZ
item.description: There are nine new cases of Covid-19 in the community in New Zealand and two in the country's managed isolation and quarantine facilities, Director-General of Health Ashley Bloomfield has revealed.

item.title: Father sentenced to four years in prison for manslaughter of baby
item.description: A man has been sentenced to four years and five months' imprisonment for the manslaughter of his baby daughter last year.

item.title: Covid-19: St Lukes case under investigation now linked to cluster
item.description: The Covid-19 case at St Lukes that was being reinvestigated has now been linked to the existing cluster.

item.title: Canterbury DHB woes: 'Somebody needs to come to their senses'
item.description: A Christchurch doctor is calling on the Health Minister to intervene in the face of an exodus of senior managers, a huge deficit and fears of large cuts to staff and services in Canterbury.

item.title: Covid-19: Young people should not bear brunt of blame for spreading virus - expert
item.description: New Zealand's young people should not bear the brunt of the blame for spreading Covid-19 says an infectious disease expert, after an international warning youth are driving the virus's spread.

item.title: Boy arrested after stolen bus joyride
item.description: A 12 year old has stolen a bus, damaging a number of cars while joy-riding in Dunedin overnight.

item.title: Covid-19: Surge in demand for board games and jigsaws
item.description: In these uncertain times, more and more grown-ups are finding solace in jigsaws, board games and even Lego.

item.title: Climate change could mean trouble for surf breaks
item.description: About 80 percent of the surf breaks in California could be gone by the end of the century according to research into rising sea levels.

item.title: Mental health support in place ahead of Christchurch mosque gunman's sentencing
item.description: It has been over a year since the Christchurch terror attacks and preparations are underway to support the families of the mosque gunman's victims ahead of his sentencing next week.

item.title: Catching Covid-19 in lift shows 'how sneaky virus is' - Microbiologist Siouxsie Wiles
item.description: A microbiologist says it would be extremely rare for a person to become infected with Covid-19 off a lift button.

item.title: Auckland lockdown starting to 'hit hard' for some families
item.description: Another wave of job losses sparked by the second Covid-19 lockdown in Auckland is pushing some families to the limit, social services say.

item.title: Covid-19: Frequent testing of border workers crucial scientific modelling shows
item.description: Weekly testing of all border workers would greatly reduce the chance of another Covid outbreak, new scientific modelling shows.

item.title: Comfort in suicide decline but 'a very long way to go'
item.description: The overall suicide suicide rate has declined to its lowest rate in three years in New Zealand, but deaths among Asians and the elderly are increasing.

item.title: Iwi say they will reopen Northland checkpoints near Kawakawa
item.description: An iwi-led checkpoint in the Far North will be in place today due to concerns from the community that too many vehicles have been travelling into the region.

item.title: New Hawke's Bay District Health Board head pledges to improve services
item.description: The new chief executive of Hawke's Bay District Health Board is pledging to improve services, especially for MÄori and Pasifika, while also cutting the health budget.
